result.execSummary:
The defendant David Lee Buford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Lee Buford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Lee Buford was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • David Lee Buford was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3: Court ordered all costs, fees and surcharges IMPOSED, including the DV surcharge. Costs and surcharges are to be taken from 25% of the defendant's prison wages. If the defendant fails to pay all costs, surcharges and/or restitution before the end of the sentence, a civil judgment shall be entered.

11-20-15 Correction to 10-05-15 JOC:
Count 1 sentence is ordered consecutive
Consecutive to: with credit for 0 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample to the Data Bank; surcharge IMPOSED

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentences.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Lee Buford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (17 pages) commencing 09-30-2015 received and filed.  CH
Reflects clerical error correction; count 1 is ordered consecutive.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received & filed.

Defendant David Lee Buford in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant David Lee Buford in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sentencing proceeded.  Statement by both counsel and the defendant.  Additional statement by Steve L.
  Statements made as to sentencing.  
As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 60 MONTHS, consecutive, with credit for -0- DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause;
- Follow all rules of extended supervision
- Court ordered all costs, fees and surcharges IMPOSED, including the DV surcharge. Costs and surcharges are to be taken from 25% of the defendant's prison wages. 
If the defendant fails to pay all cost, surcharges and/or restitution before the end of the sentence, a civil judgement shall be entered. 

. As to count 3:
Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with -0- credit, concurrent with count 1.
.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank- Surcharge IMPOSED.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant David Lee Buford not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant was prepared to proceed to trial.  Jury brought up.
The defendant wants to change his plea.  The court will allow it.
.
Plea hearing proceeded.
.
As to counts 1 and 3:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to counts 2 and 4:
Pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 2 and 4 dismissed.
The victim, Crystal M.  made a statement to the court.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Jury Trial on August 24, 2015 @ 8:30am Received and Filed

Defendant David Lee Buford in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant David Lee Buford in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab  
Amended Information received and filed charging a 4th count of Strangulation & Suffocation, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater.
     Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  
Received and filed:
State's Witness List.  District attorney informs the defense that the offer is revoked.
Case remains calendared for jury trial on 08/24/2015 at 08:30 a.m. in Branch 36.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant David Lee Buford not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Lee Buford in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant David Lee Buford in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Krystle M. or Deontae D.

Defendant David Lee Buford in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant David Lee Buford in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
